item.title: What Can Europe Offer a Fragmenting World?
item.description: As the rivalry between the United States and China intensifies, many countries are seeking partners they can trust. The European Union could fill that role by offering economic opportunity, a secure investment environment, and legal systems that are predictable and fair.

item.title: Can the Developing World Weather the Next Financial Crisis?
item.description: As asset prices soar and speculative money floods into risky markets, the global financial system is slipping back into perilous territory. When the inevitable correction arrives, the fallout will spread far beyond the United States and Europe, hitting developing economies already weighed down by debt and uncertainty.

item.title: ASEAN’s Moment of Truth

item.title: Trump’s Violent New Monroe Doctrine
item.description: US airstrikes in the Caribbean reflect President Donald Trump’s view of intra-American relations as hierarchical.
